result.execSummary:
The defendant Lorenzo C Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lorenzo C Turner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lorenzo C Turner was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Lorenzo C Turner was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each count concur.
Concurrent with: count 5

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge & court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

11:06 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 2 and 5.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1, 3 and 4. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNTS #2 and 5   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count cc to eachother  

CONDITIONS:
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

Ct #2 and 5
